nodes.text: MB-12 was a BB-series astromech droid that served the Resistance on board the MC85 Star Cruiser Raddus at some point prior to the starship's destruction in 34 ABY. While on board the Raddus, the droid was ordered to report to the vessel's repair bay in order to have a performance chip replaced and diagnostics run. MB-12 recorded the order and an image of the repair bay on an Internal Data Recorder.

MB-12 later ended up in the Droid Depot in Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu during the world's occupation by the First Order in 34 ABY. The BB unit was displayed alongside fellow astromech droids JB-9 and J1-B2 in an alcove behind one of the counters in the depot. Like all BB-series astromech droids, MB-12 was manufactured by Industrial Automaton and stood 0.67 meters tall. It had black and brown paneling and a black sensor.

MB-12 appeared as an animatronic within the themed land Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge, which opened to guests at Disneyland Park and Disney's Hollywood Studios Park in 2019. The droid is capable of emitting beeps and whistles while two lights flash on its head. The droid simultaneously appeared in Star Wars: Datapad, an application launched alongside Galaxy's Edge. The image used in the application to represent MB-12's memory of the Raddus is an image from the 2017 video game Star Wars: Droid Repair Bay.
